title: Show Don't Tell: Figma's New Embedding Transforms Prototypes into Interactive Workflow Staples

paragraphs.content: Figma announced on January 23, 2026, the launch of embedding capabilities for Figma Make prototypes directly into Figma Design, FigJam, and Figma Slides, enabling interactive sharing without leaving the workflow.This "show don't tell" feature allows teams to paste a Make file URL, creating playable embeds with full interactions like scrolling, clicking, and dragging, resizable to fit layouts.Figma Make has exited beta for all users, marking a key milestone in AI-driven prototyping.

primarySource.name: Figma Blog
primarySource.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

additionalSources.name: figma
additionalSources.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

paragraphs.content: The embedding process renders a preview thumbnail with a play button, supporting the same flows as the original file, though complex files may slow with multiple plays.Users can stop playback, reset, go to the source, or resize embeds, requiring view/edit access to the Make file and edit access to the destination.This integration reduces guesswork in discussions by grounding teams in real experiences over static screenshots.

primarySource.name: help
primarySource.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

additionalSources.name: youtube
additionalSources.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

sections.title: Embedding Process Unlocks Seamless Prototype Interactions Across Figma Tools

paragraphs.content: Teams paste Figma Make file URLs into Design, FigJam, or Slides to generate interactive embeds that mimic original prototype behaviors precisely.New editing tools in Make include previewing prompt changes via a to-do list, point-and-edit for text or element removal, and an in-app chat for refinements.These updates provide precision controls, allowing users to track model steps and guide workflows before execution.

primarySource.name: youtube
primarySource.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

additionalSources.name: help
additionalSources.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

paragraphs.content: Browser-only embeds prompt access requests for unauthorized viewers, positioning them ideally for PRDs, specs, and testing scenarios.Figma's Embed API and Kit 2.0 extend programmatic integration for design systems and FigJam notes.Release notes emphasize bringing prototypes into every workflow stage for vision-sharing and evolution.

primarySource.name: youtube
primarySource.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

additionalSources.name: figma
additionalSources.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

sections.title: Real-World Use Cases Drive Feedback Loops in FigJam, Design, and Slides

paragraphs.content: In FigJam, embeds center alignment on early ideas, enabling clicks through experiences to prioritize features and spot user journey gaps.Figma Design reviews benefit from side-by-side iterations, comparing UI, copy, and interactions for concrete feedback.Slides unlock high-fidelity collaboration with live prototypes as shared references during cross-functional presentations.

primarySource.name: cybernews
primarySource.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

additionalSources.name: vault
additionalSources.title: Show don't tell: Embed Make prototypes everywhere you work in Figma

paragraphs.content: This reduces static talks, speeding iteration by pairing prototypes directly with designs.Community tutorials highlight embedding for client-ready demos from drafts, praising quick loading for prototypes.Broader AI reviews note Make as a prompt-to-app engine producing interactive frontend code within Figma.
